comments.commentBody: What is crystal clear in reading these comments is that so many of you hyper-educated so-called liberals have absolutely no idea what the proper role of a judge is relative to the other branches of government. The only question the judge should be answering is whether the executive order conflicts with federal law. Just because so many of you elitist snobs think one way or another on a particular issue does not mean that if a judge rules against your policy preference that he is engaged in reactionary judicial activism worthy of the Taliban. Seriously guys, you come across as woefully ignorant. This decision is the exact opposite of judicial activism.

This shows how much damage the Republicans are willing to do to this country. First you have the Chief Justice declaring that corporations are real persons entitled to unlimited political monetary contributions and upsetting more than a century of precedents. At his confirmation John Roberts said that he would respect settled precedents. Soon these goons will dictate to us that the only day on which people may worship is Sunday. Beyond that, every future president will be bound by the orders and policies of his predecessor. What a ridiculous state of affairs, and what legally inept justices the republicans have insisted on selecting? God help us all !

Pardon me, if we allow the order to "stand", although it does feel like we have been "stabbed" in the back by Obama.

To give proper credit, I apologize my cut and paste did not work to provide the author of the quote in my comment.

National Ocean Council

By Cassandra Anderson
July 28, 2010

Cells are everywhere! Scratch your head ... cells all over the place. When you wash off the dirt and grime in the shower ... cells everywhere! A cell is not a person! This is insanity. It's not at all about "protecting the sanctity of life," or whatever other disingenuous spin they want to put on it. It's about intolerance and dogmatism from a scarily growing fringe of religious and political zealots. These are the same people who don't bat an eye about killing REAL people via the death penalty and illegal "wars" that kill and main scores of living, breathing, pain-feeling human beings.

We have to get the ideologues out of office

I'm a strong Obama supporter. But thus is one area, where I have to disagree with him. They shouldn't artificially produce embryos in the first place because this practice always leaves "excess embryos".

And since it a scientifically proved fact that, once a human egg is fertilized, that he of she has all of the qualities that he or she will have if he or she is allowed to develop normally. And I keep saying, "he or she" because his or her gender is also determined at that point, along with hair and eye color etc.

So an embryo is, in every sense of the word, a little tiny human being, who should be cherished and not just discarded or used for so-called "scientific" research. Almost all of those embryos will eventually die anyway, which is whey they shouldn't be artificially manufactured it the first place.

So, the ends of "IVF", don't justify the means, which is causing to be killed, innocent human beings. So these directly interlocked "procedures", first "IVF" and then engaging in the direct killing of "excess embryos" left over from "IVF” for embryo based "scientific" research, involves two actions, both of which are intrinsically evil; first, the unjust production of these poor little people, and second, the unjust killing of them.
From what top-ranked University did the judge obtain a pH.D. in a relevant specialty of Biological Sciences before he turned to the study of law?

This is a Reagan appointee who is just finding legalistic rationales to impose his own ideology. Republicans are not shy about using their power.

What needs to be done is for Democrats to immediately pass a law that resolves the issue clearly. Then when the Republicans try to block it make this one of THE voting issues of the November election.

Most Americans want this kind of research and they understand that the stem cells would come from material that would have otherwise simply been thrown into the garbage.

The superficial dogma that drives opposition to this research is about ego and power trips, not respect for life. There's nothing spiritually valid in preserving some cells so they can be trashed as opposed to using them to help save lives!
882 days until change we can believe in.
Monty Python's "Every Sperm Is Sacred"

Well kind of sad for the people with M.S. and A.L.S and all neurological problems. But that is your pro-life crowd. Embryos are babies. This is very sad for loved ones that are suffering and in pain to take away hope.
preborn????!!!!!

#87 - the embryos are alive, yet unborn human beings.  This country defends the right of life in the Bill of Rights.  Maybe this country would be a more civilized place if we had more respect for protecting the innocent.
There is only one group of people who's against this life saving research and I'm ashamed to be linked to them. Christians. You all should be ashamed of yourselves!
Wonderful! A well deserved loss for the liberal wing of this nation. Now on to the fall elections where the voters will remove many more.

Is it any wonder more and more scientific discoveries are made overseas when we are ruled by right wing Christians who force their religious dogma on all of us?

What is next promoting the concept the world is flat and the universe revolves around the earth.

The greatest threat to future scientific discovery and moving our nation forward are conservative Christians.
Why are we so intent on turning back the clock to the Dark Ages?

And religious people wonder why I became a Humanist. Let me list some of the reasons:
- Having reverence for a few cells with a supernatural "soul" over the life of actual living, suffering human beings
- The enthusiastic support of the Religious Right for unnecessary, mega-expensive mass-murder (the war in Iraq) because the Prince of Peace told Bush (& Palin) to start a war (for oil, based on lies)
- Enthusiastically supporting greed and denial of help to the poor and those dying of treatable medical conditions so the money can be spent on war
- Supporting irrational ideas about the evil of birth control, contributing to catastrophic overpopulation
- Denying rights to homosexuals
- Trying to teach falsehoods for science
- Christians, Jews and Muslims and their innumerable sects, each believing theirs is the truth which conflicts with all the others' beliefs, prejudiced against each other and sometimes killing each other
etc., etc.

Apparently, one comment was too strong for some who would end the life of an unborn. Let's try again. Earthquakes, floods, tusanmies, aids, cancer, must we go on? God left us to manage this world. What about the next?? Good luck to most of you, good luck!!!!

As some people have said we are becoming a third world country both economically, culturally and technologically. This was a perfect opportunity to take the lead in trying to find a cure for so many medical issues.
The dumbing down of this country by the decreasing of educational opportunity (thanks Ronald Reagan) has increased the ignorance in this country to such an extent that most of the population does not see this as priority---shame on this country and the people who live in it!
Two years out of office, and George W. Bush is still ruining America.
Another stab in the face of our leadership in science ... not very adifferent from the 'backwordness' of the Taliban and fundamentialst Saudis!
Conservative Christians seem consumed with crushing common sense in this country

@ ryanhaas:

You are correct. It is not a typo. It is possible because it was alleged that the embryos had standing. The same judge who ruled that two plaintiffs did have "standing" — necessary for one to be heard as a plaintiff — ruled that the embryos did not have standing.

What is most disturbing to me is the clear self-serving interests of James Sherley and Theresa Deisher.  This case is yet another reason why medical research and treatment should be a non-profit industry.  Otherwise, you have a couple of researchers who think their grants won't be competitive shutting down a particularly promising area of research for so many disease cures.  Thank you, Sherley and Deisher.  Has anyone checked to see where the judge has invested his money?

We really need to get back to having our elected officials make decisions and not federal judges.  I am not sure I agree or disagree with the President's decision here, but it should be his call, not some judge's.
